segments.text: I see the woman with her apron and knee-length dress, looking so domestic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet the scene around her feels anything but calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The overflowing sink is starting to feel like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascading down the cabinets is alarming; she should be more aware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she stay so focused on that plate when chaos is thriving around her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s daring attempt to reach the cookie jar is both entertaining and terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout, to warn them, but I’m only an observer here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The little girl’s excitement for a cookie almost makes me forget the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I remember the unstable stool, and my stomach drops again.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s interesting how life can seem so perfect outside that window while chaos brews inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
